chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremy J Roe was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcoholic beverages.
Defendant shall not go upon any premises whose primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.
Defendant shall not possess any illegal drugs/substances/paraphernalia as defined in Chapter 961.
Defendant shall not go upon any premises where he believes such contraband, as defined in Chapter 961, may be present.
Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle on a highway in this State unless authorized by MVD.
Defendant shall not operate a vehicle anywhere with any amount of alcohol in his system.
Defendant shall not operate a vehicle anywhere with any detectable amount of restricted controlled substances in his blood.

Defendant to pay supervision fees as determined by DOC.
Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations.
Defendant shall possess prescription medication only by valid prescription and take in the manner and method as prescribed by physician.
Defendant shall purchase prescription medications from one pharmacy only.
Defendant shall report new or changing medications to Agent within 72 hours.

Conditions of Extended Supervision/Probation:
- pay all costs/supervision fees/restitution/restitution surcharge
- submit to assessments/counseling and abide by treatment recommendations
- not possess or consume any alcoholic beverages
- not go upon any premises whose primary purpose is the sale of alcohol
- not possess any illegal drugs/substances/paraphernalia as defined in Ch. 961
- not go upon any premises where he believes such contraband as defined in Ch. 961 may be present
- not operate a motor vehicle on a highway in this state unless authorized by the Motor Vehicle Department
- not operate a vehicle anywhere with any amount of alcohol in his system
- not operate a vehicle anywhere with any detectable amount of restricted controlled substances in blood
- possess prescription medication only by valid prescription and take in the manner and method as prescribed by physician
- purchase prescription medications from one pharmacy only
- report new or changing medications to Agent within 72 hours
- IID 3 years
